biogHist.abstract: The Kildonan UnitingCare Records collection dates from 1881 to 2001. The records relate to the operation of Kildonan UnitingCare and its predecessor agencies. The collection includes client files, admission records, photographs and publications.
biogHist.p: The Uniting Heritage Service supports past residents of Kildonan looking for records or information about their time in care. If you were a past resident or client of Kildonan or any of the orphanages, homes and other residences run by its predecessor organisations, there may be information and history about you held there. Limited records are available before the 1960s but more detailed information is available from then on.

The collection includes a complete set of individual files and records relating to Kildonan residents dating back to 1881, and these are well documented. For example, it includes the admission and after care books details of those children taken into care from 1881. Individual paper files were produced from 1912, and these have been catalogued and filed. A separate card index was also in use from 1951 - 1983 recording the details of those children in care. From the 1960s, there are large individual file records and day book entries. The collection contains some memorabilia and Committee minutes and records dating from 1918 - 1964, and a selection of Annual Reports.

The collection includes a large collection of photographs dating from approximately 1940 - 2000. In 2013 Kildonan UnitingCare received a Commonwealth Government Grant which enabled it to describe its photographic and slide collection that were commissioned for fundraising and promotional activities, and identify as many children and workers as possible with the help of past residents. The focus is on photos of children in care from 1940 - 1980, and, on making those photos available to past residents.
Below is a detailed list of the types of records in the collection:

list.item: Letters from Selina Sutherland (found amongst the pages of the Admissions Book)
Communications books from residential care units (1994, 1997-2001)
Board of Governance Minutes, Correspondence and Papers
Files related to the various Programs and Projects run by Kildonan, including family group homes, adolescent units and foster care
Copies of Marjorie Robinson, Kildonan: One Hundred years of Care 1881-1981, published by the Council of the Uniting Church Kildonan Homes for Children, Camberwell, 1981
Typed historical account of Kildonan's formation [date unknown]
Artwork proof of brochure 'A New Direction for Kildonan Homes for Children' [dates unknown]
Presbyterian and Scots Church Children's Aid Society (1920-1953)
Black Scots Church District Association metal chest [date unknown]
Brown Scots Church Convalescents Aid Society metal chest [date unknown]
Video of Bruce Osborne's retirement [date unknown]
HiFidelity Tape Reel - 'No Lonely Life' Jubilee Dinner [date unknown]
Film reel - 'In and About Fitzroy' - the film was prepared by young people at Fitzroy Adolescent Unit for a public meeting, November 1984
Framed certificate from the Lady in Waiting at Government House to the President thanking the Children of Kildonan Homes for flowers they sent to Her Majesty [date unknown]

biogHist.p: The records are catalogued in a MS Access database. From 2006, records that were requested have been digitised.

This collection of records contains some items about Dhurringile Rural Training Farm (i.e. Admission registers with names, and committee meeting minutes that refer to Dhurringile). Please note that this collection does not contain the Client Files, Dhurringile Training Farm (1948? - 1964?).

Any records relating to adoptions arranged by Kildonan's predecessor organisations are released through the Adoption Information Service, Connections Uniting Care. This is because of the requirements of the Adoption Act 1984. Staff at either Uniting or Connections UnitingCare can help with accessing adoption records.
There is an MS Access database which lists the location and box number of all individual client files from 1912 onwards.

There are some copies of Annual Reports and other general reports at the following archives:
1. Scots Church - older Annual Reports, newsletters etc. from 1881 to 1977
2. Presbyterian Archive - Annual Reports, newsletters etc. from 1881 to 1977
3. UnitingCare and Uniting Church Archives - from 1977 to present day Annual Reports, newsletters etc.

Kildonan has established a Heritage Program which is currently staffed one day per week by a paid member of staff. Part of the program also includes volunteers who are able to assist with file and committee minute records searches.
Early records up until 1960 generally contain a card file and correspondence between the Home and parents. When staff resources are available, an additional search is made for personal information which may be contained in the Home Committee minutes. When located, such information is transcribed and vetted according to protect the private details of individuals.

descriptiveNote.p: There are some items about Dhurringile held at Kildonan UnitingCare (e.g. admission registers with names, and committee meeting minutes that refer to Dhurringile). Client files are held by UnitingCare Victoria and Tasmania.
